title: Test compilation fails with Clang and optimizations enabled
body:
## Description
Compiling the Catch2 tests fails when `-Werror` (CMake option `CATCH_ENABLE_WERROR`) and optimizations are enabled (e.g., by setting `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE` to `Release`). The error messages are:
```
$ make -k
[  1%] Building CXX object projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/SelfTest/UsageTests/Exception.tests.cpp.o
/tmp/tmp.dGjYkxxzKV/Catch2/projects/SelfTest/UsageTests/Exception.tests.cpp:30:12: error: will never be
      executed [-Werror,-Wunreachable-code]
    return 1;
           ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/SelfTest/UsageTests/Exception.tests.cpp.o] Error 1
[  2%] Building CXX object projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/__/include/internal/catch_matchers_floating.cpp.o
/tmp/tmp.dGjYkxxzKV/Catch2/include/internal/catch_matchers_floating.cpp:114:37: error: will never be
      executed [-Werror,-Wunreachable-code]
            throw std::domain_error("Unknown FloatingPointKind value");
                                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/__/include/internal/catch_matchers_floating.cpp.o] Error 1
make[2]: Target `projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/build' not remade because of errors.
make[1]: *** [projects/CMakeFiles/SelfTest.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: Target `all' not remade because of errors.
make: *** [all] Error 2
make: Target `default_target' not remade because of errors.
```

### Steps to reproduce
Configure Catch2 with CMake as follows and build:
```
CC=clang CXX=clang++ cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -- ../Catch2/
```


### Extra information
* Catch version: v2.3.0
* Operating system: Linux Mint
* Compiler+version: `Ubuntu clang version 3.4-1ubuntu3 (tags/RELEASE_34/final) (based on LLVM 3.4) (Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu, Thread model: posix)`
